intro: Restio uniflorus, commonly known as the single-flowered restia, is a member of the Restionaceae family, native to southern Africa. It is a perennial grass-like plant that typically grows in coastal and sandy environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces a single, spike-like inflorescence with small, white flowers. It is adapted to withstand salt spray and sandy soils, making it a hardy coastal species. The plant plays a role in stabilizing dune ecosystems and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
